comments:
I downloaded and installed latest WTP 1.0M8 on my Eclipse 3.1 and restarted 
Eclipse with the -clean parameter. If I open the J2EE perspective, some views 
of the former perspective just get greyed out and the log shows:

Hi, Can you verify this isn't a setup issue?   Can you create a new M8 target?
We haven't seen this problem, and it really looks like your environment is
missing some plugins.

Dropping this severity - please verify environment - unable to reproduce.

What level was old workspace created on?

Chuck, might be related to install ... but might also be related to having
certain  "web services resource" in workspace that provoke a certain path
through the code. I notice the 
WebServicePlugin 
does ALOT during its start (or, the start causes a lot to happen).Is it
processing some resources? using create execuatable extensions? These things
might "force" it to try and load certain things in a non-friendly way (from the
eclipse plugin class loader perspective). .... Of course, this is just from a
quick glance and the stack and code ... so ... just a suggestion to see if some
of that 'start' path could be more lazily initialized.

Ok I agree some of these startup routines are no longer needed, especially since
they were put in place to handle a partial webservice install that we had
previously. - I'm going to change the summary to reflect the issue. - Is it
really blocking?

Ok one other item....   this class that is not found has changed package names,
so I would think without a -clean, its possible a bad reference exists?

I solved it by first install the wtp-all-in-one-0.7.1-win32.zip (178 MB!) and 
afterwards wtp-1.0M8.zip (only 24 MB) in addition. It seems that this wtp-
1.0M8.zip file is not a full installation but just an upgrade?

Yes thanks for explaining - this makes sense now.

The M8 driver only contains the "WTP" plugins and not all of the required
dependent packages (EMF,GEF,JEM,Base).  Also - because there were major
structural changes in M8 from 0.7.1, it isn't a good idea to overlay drivers
this way.

Always setting up the prerequisite packages with the WTP driver will ensure
a consistent environment.

This doesn't seem to be enough as I already installed the required GEF, EMF, 
etc. It only worked after I installed the 0.7.1 in addition.

This bug was moved to 'closed' state, since it is so old and since it is a dup, worksforme, invalid bug that its unlikely to still be useful or need further attention. Feel free to re-open, or open a new bug, if this semi-automatic processing was done in error.
